Title: the emotion detection automation

Leonard: What’s going on with that woman you’re dating?
Why?
Ignore him. Yeah, sorry about the breakup.
You’re not being very nice.
Careful, I saw this on Star Trek. Smoke’s gonna come out of his ears soon. Hey.
And you think we can get those guys to reprogram Sheldon? Cool.
That a bunch of awkward scientists with no social skills would invent a machine to do it for them?
I was thinking maybe a library or a gaming room.
I don’t like trains. You like trains.
Well, when you get the machine, you can find out.
No, Raj, that’s a terrible idea.
Hey, great news. The TV I want will fit in the gaming room, and if I leave the curtains open, I can watch it from work.
Oh. Yeah. Okay, sure. What’s going on with your brother?
Huh. Is that a good idea? I mean, you think they’ll consider someone who was in prison for selling drugs?
Well, I’m sure he’ll appreciate carrying his samples in a briefcase instead of his colon. How long do you think he’ll stay?
Hmm. Who knows? That’s exciting. I’ll get to wake up every morning and see if he’s still here.
Of course not. I mean, he’s your brother.
Remember that when the new TV falls off the wall and crushes us both.
Yeah, sure. He really worked with the Drug Enforcement Agency?
How’s it working out?
That’s great, I’m happy for you.
No, it doesn’t.
No.
I said no.
Fine. You invited your drug dealer brother to stay with us for God knows how long and didn’t bother to ask me first.
I’m not saying you have to ask my permission, but you could have talked to me about it before you said it was okay.
Our gaming room. I was gonna put a scented candle in it.
Because I didn’t want to sound like a jerk.
If you get him a job, he’s gonna live here forever!
Has he ever had his own place?
Did it have a metal toilet next to the bed?
Stay out of this. You and your stupid machine started this fight.
We owe you an apology.
That was six years ago. I’m talking about tonight.
And, sorry about the suitcase.
Mm, Penny’s gonna call her dad and tell him it’s not a good time for Randall to visit.
Oh, you’re his little girl, he can’t stay mad at you.
So you’re gonna throw me under the bus?
That’s because we are.
We can’t. He was already fixed when I found him at the shelter.
Raj: I broke up with her.
She said she didn’t want to see me any more and I found that insulting.
I don’t know, she didn’t even give me a reason.
Can we not play this game?
That’s okay, I’m fine.
I’m not a virgin, Sheldon.
It’s okay, I’m fine.
Sheldon, when I said I was fine, I meant I didn’t want to talk about it any more.
Now that Sheldon’s across the hall, have you decided what you’re doing with his old room?
Maybe I could use it to understand why women keep dumping me.
That’s actually not a bad idea. Maybe I could even get them all together, sort of like a, a focus group, to find out what’s wrong with me.
Yeah. I’m getting all my exes together in order to discuss why they broke up with me and how I can be a better boyfriend.
We are going to find out.
Well, I want information in order to improve myself.
Don’t worry, I’m a grown man. I have a thick skin.
Hey.
Okay, first off, I want to thank you all so much for coming. Howard is here to interpret for Emily, and to take notes.
Uh, heads up, both of you are named Emily, so we’ll call you red-headed Emily, and you, red-headed Emily, Junior.
Okay, uh, let’s get things started. Um, why don’t we go around the room, say your name, and why you broke up with me. Want to kick it off?
I did do that. I can be insensitive to other people’s boundaries. Howard, would you write that down?
Uh, next?
Okay, new rule, everybody only gets one. Uh, next?
Oh. He’s here to support me, so anything you have to say you can say in front of him.
Howard, get out.
Okay, that’s enough. Write down loving son.
Yes, I’ll take you back.
Well, that’s hard to hear, but I’ll still take you back.
Would you stop writing? Wait, so, did all of you go on to better relationships after me?
What did she say?
Okay, maybe we should just end this.
Thank you, Howard.
Well, that was a waste of time. I’m such an idiot.
Maybe I won’t settle down. Maybe I’ll just play the field.
Dude, come on.
I appreciate the offer, but if things don’t work out with you two, I’m swooping in on her like a vulture.
But theoretically, if you and I were in a gay relationship, how would we tell people? Like, print up announcements?
Well, I want to make sure we get invited to all the parades.
Yeah. Well, if you want to march in a fishnet crop top, you better lay off that dip.
It was for the girls. They broke up with me, I don’t care if they get fat.
Oh, you want to bet? You never exercise.
Very mature. Keep eating like that, you’re gonna have a heart attack.
You’re such a child.
Hey, I was being hypothetical, okay? I would never marry you.
Yeah, right. Wait, is it rose gold? Actually, don’t tell me, I want to be surprised.
You know, I just read a study that suggests new mothers are better at sensing emotions for up to two years.
Howard: I thought things were going well. What happened?
Sometimes people say things they don’t mean.
Because that’s not what people do.
You if it’s at MIT, I can make some calls. Maybe we can get Sheldon a prototype.
Sheldon, I just heard from the guys at MIT about that emotion reader. They’re sending a prototype for you to beta test.
Well, you don’t need a machine for that, just send a survey card to all your ex-girlfriends and tell them if they fill it out they might win a prize.
Yeah, I was joking.
This thing’s pretty cool. It interprets emotions using a wireless signal to analyse subtle changes in breathing and heart rate.
The display is synced to your phone. Give it a try.
Okay, remember, it can only detect happy, sad, angry and excited. Not other things you’re feeling, like, what have I done with my life?
Try another one.
Oh, God. You went through with that? What is wrong with you?
You’re so stupid.
No, he doesn’t think it’s stupid.
Hey, you went out with him. I didn’t.
Like this one?
Schmuck. Got it.
Not a chance. So, you were telling us how Raj was terrible in bed.
Sorry, is that Gary with one R or two?
Uh, basically, she traded you for Bruce Wayne.
Wait, hang on. I just want to point out to everyone here, this is a man who is going to great lengths to better himself. Even at the risk of being humiliated. And I, for one, think that’s very brave.
Well, like you gals, I had to suffer through him to find Bernadette.
Thanks, ladies, this was fun. Let’s not wait so long for another bizarre, awkward night.
Don’t beat yourself up. That’s what I’m here for.
Yeah, the field was just here. The field said no.
Okay, I’ll tell you what. I’ll make you a deal. 30 years from now, if you’re still single and things don’t work out with me and Bernadette, you and I can give it a go.
Too late. Stuart called dibs.
I don’t know. What difference does it make?
Those do look fun.
If you didn’t want me to eat it, why’d you put it out?
I’m not gonna get fat.
Fine. Look, I’ll exercise right now. One, two. These are crunches, by the way.
Okay. How about if I eat like this?
Hey, is that any way to talk to your future husband?
Please. When you see the ring I pick out, you’re gonna melt.
Sheldon: That’s not a problem, we can figure this out. What are the reasons women reject Raj?
Doesn’t like games. That’s one.
Of course you’re fine. Not every member of a species finds a mate. Sir Isaac Newton died a virgin, look at the contributions he made.
So now you think you’re better than Isaac Newton? Oh, no wonder women don’t like you.
What? He said he was fine.
Oh, that’s a paradox. I mean if you meant what you just said, then that means you may not have meant what you just said.
Well, I thought we were having a nice conversation, but it turns out I was being offensive.
Yeah.
We were discussing Raj’s recent breakup and apparently, I was insensitive to him.
Don’t fall for it. He’ll get you to compare him to a dead virgin, and suddenly you’re the bad guy.
Then why didn’t you say that?
Well, I would prefer if people told me exactly what is on their mind.
Well, it certainly would be easier. You have no idea what it’s like to struggle with recognizing emotional cues.
Thank you.
Okay, now you’re just showing off.
A machine that reads emotions is intriguing. It could help me be a more considerate friend.
It could also help me identify my enemies, discover their fears and then I could use those fears to destroy them.
You could make it a train room.
I know, and Amy says I can’t have a train room.
Wonderful. Although I’m not sure how I feel about being used as a guinea pig.
Yes. Now, when the robots rise up, they’ll know that I’ve been rooting for them the whole time.
You are happy?
Aw. Somebody’s ignoring their tiny needle teeth, but all right.
Sad.
Oh, that makes sense, ’cause she’s gone and you miss her.
And you’re worried that turkey neck is in your future. What, now, see, now it says you’re mad. Make up your mind.
Hey, Leonard, if you’re happy and you know it, no need to clap your hands, because I have an emotion detector.
Surprisingly well.
No, wait, uh, hold on. Oh, what, you are. Aren’t you sweet?
Oh, ooh! And that makes Leonard angry.
What, Leonard, please. I know an angry face when I see it. It’s this red frowny guy on my phone.
Yes.
It’s like you’re twins.
Well, hey. Now she’s angry, too. This thing works like gangbusters.
He’s still mad.
You first.
Hey, I shared my Honey Nut Cheerios with you.
You are lucky that this feelings machine doesn’t have feelings.
Gladly. Can we storm out?
Fine. I’ll just give them the finger.
Not really.
I wish I never tried that device. And I know I said the same thing after the massage chair, but this time I mean it.
It’s more than that. It’s me. I always knew I had trouble recognizing other people’s emotions, but that machine just made it so real.
I thought I was getting better at it, but clearly I’m not.
Yeah, but that’s shooting fish in a barrel. You’re kind of a sad sack. I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have said that. I’m just upset.
I feel the same way about you. Now, put your glasses back on. You look weird.
Yes?
Oh, it’s fine. You needed a suitcase, I wasn’t home, you borrowed a suitcase.
Oh. Well, I thought we were going in order.
Yeah, well, you should be. Your socks were still in it. I had to throw it away. Anyway, I, uh, trust that you’ve resolved your conflict.
Uh, guys, it sounds like you’re getting angry again.
Yes. I don’t need an emotion machine. I am one.
I did. You know, I’m not even sure how accurate it was. I took it to the train store, it said everyone was sad.
Hey, uh, Bernadette, let’s test this theory. What do you think I’m feeling right now?
Keep filling this one with babies. She’s good.
Penny: Hey, boys. How’s it going?
No. No, you don’t, you really don’t. I actually can’t say don’t enough.
Wow, I find that hard to believe.
I take it back. I believe it.
Hey, can you hold off redoing the room? My brother’s coming out here in a few weeks.
My dad asked if I can get him a job interview at my work.
Well, I sell pharmaceuticals. That’s just a really hard to spell word for drugs.
I, I’m not sure. Maybe a few days. Unless he gets the job, then who knows?
You don’t have a problem with this, do you?
Okay. Thank you, you’re the best. Mm.
Hey, would you take a look at my brother’s résumé? I’m trying to help him clean it up a little.
He didn’t know it till he was cuffed, but yeah.
No, it’s my brother’s. I’m trying to help him get a job out here.
What? Are you really upset about Randall coming?
Leonard, if you’re mad about this, just tell me.
He’s my brother. I didn’t think I needed your permission.
Like you talked to me about your gaming room?
If you were this upset, why didn’t you say so when I told you?
Well, you sound like one now. I don’t see the big deal if my brother comes and stays for a while.
He would get his own place.
Yes.
It still counts. You know, how is this any different from you making me live with Sheldon?
You gave me a bill at the end of every month.
Look, we got really angry at each other, and you just got caught in the middle of it.
Yes, we’re fine.
Hopefully, he won’t be too upset.
He won’t be mad at me. I mean, you’re the one who doesn’t want my brother to come, so…
Oh, I’m gonna throw you so hard, I might actually win a stuffed animal.
So, did you wind up sending that machine back?
So, all we need to do is get Sheldon knocked up.
Bernadette: You know, I just read that a team at MIT. developed a device that helps people read human emotions.
It’s supposed to be accurate, like, 85% of the time.
Why would you do that, Raj?
You’re not gonna get information, you’re just gonna get criticism that hurts your feelings.
I finally got Halley to sleep.
Let’s see. You’re better than us, a little bit sorry for us, but mostly glad you don’t have to be us.
Amy: Sheldon, what did you do?
I’m sure it’s extremely frustrating.
And also a little sad.
What do you think?
It’s amazing a machine can do that.
All right. Now, I’m gonna look at some pictures to prompt an emotional response, and we’ll see if the machine can identify them accurately.
Okay, I’m looking at the first picture.
Yes. I’m looking at puppi
Okay. What does it say I’m feeling?
Yes. I’m looking at a picture of my grandma.
Yes.
What’s that? Are you working on your resume?
Stop enjoying their fight.
Come on, Sheldon, let’s go.
I think it loses its impact if we’re chatting about it.
Sheldon, dinner’s ready. I made beef loaf, because I know you’re uncomfortable with the non-specificity of meat loaf. Sheldon? Hey, are you okay?
What’s going on?
I’m sorry Leonard and Penny hurt your feelings.
Well, everybody has things that they need help with. Like me, I can’t see without my glasses. And right now you’re just a, a cute, pink smudge wearing a childish green smudge.
Yes, you are. There have definitely been days when I was sad and you could tell.

No, see, right there, you knew you hurt my feelings. And I’m proud of you, for reasons I’m sure have something to do with my father. And if you don’t like that machine, get rid of it. Because I love you exactly the way you are.
It’s true. Pregnancy causes physiological changes in the brain that result in increased empathy.
Sheldon: Really? Uh, little tip: jokes are often better when you end them with wocka wocka or ha-cha-cha.
Raj (on phone): Okay, Emily. Yeah, sounds great. See you then.
Lucy: Oh, okay. Um, I’m Lucy, and I broke up with Raj because I have severe social anxiety, and he kept trying to force me into uncomfortable situations.
Can I just say something? Going out with Raj was one of the best things that ever happened to me.
Let me finish. It’s like I needed to go through that experience to know what exactly I don’t want in a man.
Claire: Okay. Um, I’m Claire. And I guess I broke up with you because you were just really needy. Also, you were incredibly vain, like, all the time you spent shaping your eyebrows.
Emily: Ooh, I’m not sure I’m comfortable sharing details about our relationship in front of Howard.
Okay. Well, whenever you and I were in bed…
Oh, yeah, that used to drive me nuts. He’s kind of a mama’s boy.
You know, the same thing happened to me. After I broke up with Raj, I met Gary, who’s just amazing.
Honestly, I’m surprised you two didn’t wind up together.
Howard (translating for other Emily): I thought you were great, but, oh, my God, you were so dominated by your parents.
Howard (responding to other Emily): Oh, wow. Don’t let him get away.

Yes. I’m looking at a picture of my grandma.

Oh, God. You went through with that? What is wrong with you?
We are going to find out.
Why would you do that, Raj?
Well, I want information in order to improve myself.
You’re not gonna get information, you’re just gonna get criticism that hurts your feelings.
Don’t worry, I’m a grown man. I have a thick skin.

Yeah, sure. He really worked with the Drug Enforcement Agency?

That’s great, I’m happy for you.

Oh, ooh! And that makes Leonard angry.
What, Leonard, please. I know an angry face when I see it. It’s this red frowny guy on my phone.
What? Are you really upset about Randall coming?
Leonard, if you’re mad about this, just tell me.
Fine. You invited your drug dealer brother to stay with us for God knows how long and didn’t bother to ask me first.
He’s my brother. I didn’t think I needed your permission.
Well, hey. Now she’s angry, too. This thing works like gangbusters.
I’m not saying you have to ask my permission, but you could have talked to me about it before you said it was okay.
Like you talked to me about your gaming room?
Our gaming room. I was gonna put a scented candle in it.
If you were this upset, why didn’t you say so when I told you?
Because I didn’t want to sound like a jerk.
Well, you sound like one now. I don’t see the big deal if my brother comes and stays for a while.
If you get him a job, he’s gonna live here forever!
He would get his own place.
Has he ever had his own place?

It still counts. You know, how is this any different from you making me live with Sheldon?

Fine. I’ll just give them the finger.

No, he doesn’t think it’s stupid.

Hey, you went out with him. I didn’t.

Oh, okay. Um, I’m Lucy, and I broke up with Raj because I have severe social anxiety, and he kept trying to force me into uncomfortable situations.
I did do that. I can be insensitive to other people’s boundaries. Howard, would you write that down?

Okay, new rule, everybody only gets one. Uh, next?
Ooh, I’m not sure I’m comfortable sharing details about our relationship in front of Howard.
Oh. He’s here to support me, so anything you have to say you can say in front of him.
Okay. Well, whenever you and I were in bed…
Not a chance. So, you were telling us how Raj was terrible in bed.
Sheldon, dinner’s ready. I made beef loaf, because I know you’re uncomfortable with the non-specificity of meat loaf. Sheldon? Hey, are you okay?

I’m sorry Leonard and Penny hurt your feelings.
It’s more than that. It’s me. I always knew I had trouble recognizing other people’s emotions, but that machine just made it so real.
Well, everybody has things that they need help with. Like me, I can’t see without my glasses. And right now you’re just a, a cute, pink smudge wearing a childish green smudge.

Yes, you are. There have definitely been days when I was sad and you could tell.
Yeah, but that’s shooting fish in a barrel. You’re kind of a sad sack. I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have said that. I’m just upset.

No, see, right there, you knew you hurt my feelings. And I’m proud of you, for reasons I’m sure have something to do with my father. And if you don’t like that machine, get rid of it. Because I love you exactly the way you are.
I feel the same way about you. Now, put your glasses back on. You look weird.

Oh, yeah, that used to drive me nuts. He’s kind of a mama’s boy.
Okay, that’s enough. Write down loving son.
Can I just say something? Going out with Raj was one of the best things that ever happened to me.
Let me finish. It’s like I needed to go through that experience to know what exactly I don’t want in a man.
Well, that’s hard to hear, but I’ll still take you back.

Uh, basically, she traded you for Bruce Wayne.
Okay, maybe we should just end this.

Well, like you gals, I had to suffer through him to find Bernadette.
Oh, it’s fine. You needed a suitcase, I wasn’t home, you borrowed a suitcase.
That was six years ago. I’m talking about tonight.
Oh. Well, I thought we were going in order.
Look, we got really angry at each other, and you just got caught in the middle of it.
Yeah, well, you should be. Your socks were still in it. I had to throw it away. Anyway, I, uh, trust that you’ve resolved your conflict.
Mm, Penny’s gonna call her dad and tell him it’s not a good time for Randall to visit.
Hopefully, he won’t be too upset.
Oh, you’re his little girl, he can’t stay mad at you.
He won’t be mad at me. I mean, you’re the one who doesn’t want my brother to come, so…
So you’re gonna throw me under the bus?
Oh, I’m gonna throw you so hard, I might actually win a stuffed animal.
Uh, guys, it sounds like you’re getting angry again.
Yes. I don’t need an emotion machine. I am one.
Thanks, ladies, this was fun. Let’s not wait so long for another bizarre, awkward night.
Well, that was a waste of time. I’m such an idiot.
Don’t beat yourself up. That’s what I’m here for.
Maybe I won’t settle down. Maybe I’ll just play the field.
Yeah, the field was just here. The field said no.
Okay, I’ll tell you what. I’ll make you a deal. 30 years from now, if you’re still single and things don’t work out with me and Bernadette, you and I can give it a go.
I appreciate the offer, but if things don’t work out with you two, I’m swooping in on her like a vulture.
But theoretically, if you and I were in a gay relationship, how would we tell people? Like, print up announcements?
I don’t know. What difference does it make?
Well, I want to make sure we get invited to all the parades.
Yeah. Well, if you want to march in a fishnet crop top, you better lay off that dip.
If you didn’t want me to eat it, why’d you put it out?
It was for the girls. They broke up with me, I don’t care if they get fat.
Oh, you want to bet? You never exercise.
Fine. Look, I’ll exercise right now. One, two. These are crunches, by the way.
Very mature. Keep eating like that, you’re gonna have a heart attack.
Okay. How about if I eat like this?
Hey, is that any way to talk to your future husband?
Hey, I was being hypothetical, okay? I would never marry you.
Please. When you see the ring I pick out, you’re gonna melt.
Yeah, right. Wait, is it rose gold? Actually, don’t tell me, I want to be surprised.
So, did you wind up sending that machine back?
I did. You know, I’m not even sure how accurate it was. I took it to the train store, it said everyone was sad.
I finally got Halley to sleep.
You know, I just read a study that suggests new mothers are better at sensing emotions for up to two years.
It’s true. Pregnancy causes physiological changes in the brain that result in increased empathy.
So, all we need to do is get Sheldon knocked up.
We can’t. He was already fixed when I found him at the shelter.
Hey, uh, Bernadette, let’s test this theory. What do you think I’m feeling right now?
Let’s see. You’re better than us, a little bit sorry for us, but mostly glad you don’t have to be us.
Keep filling this one with babies. She’s good.
